Topic: Draw a habitat and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can draw and label different habitats, including at least one land habitat (like a playground or forest) and one water habitat (like a pond or stream).
The student can illustrate and label different types of plants found in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or flowering plants.
The student can illustrate and label different types of animals found in each habitat, including examples like lizards, squirrels, and fish, specific to each habitat type.
The student can compare the variety of living things by showing how the plants and animals differ between the land and water habitats.
The student can identify and show patterns in the variety of living things across different habitats through their drawings.
